reviewText: This is one of the funniest Shaun The Sheep videos I have ever seen! Everyone in my family was LOL!

I LOVE shaun the sheep!!!  I watch the complete first season over and over again (I'm 33 by the way) and love it as much as the kids do. However, I didn't really like the "new" shaun the sheep or the new story lines. The new claymation figures are harsh and the stories were kind of blah. I don't know if I will be buying another Shaun the Sheep DVD anytime soon. I think I will check them out on Netflix first before I invest in another for the collection. For now, I don't plan on watching this DVD again myself, but I am sure the kids will continue to like the stories and characters.

We got this for our 2.5 year old because we were tired of watching the sole title on Netflix streaming over and over and over...

This is one of those "kids" shows that is also entertaining for all ages (at least those of us who are still young at heart). Our son loves all the animals and their crazy antics. When he wants to watch it he yells, "Sheep! Sheep! Sheep!" :)
The audience for Shaun the Sheep was clearly meant for children, but I thought the story lines were puerile, and I was embarrassed to give it as a gift to my young granddaughters.

After watching season 1 on Netflix over and over, getting a DVD with new episodes was great. The stories are entertaining and funny. However, they seem to have made changes to the characters - the dog now has a white belly and hands and feet, and the farmer has a 5-o'clock shadow line (but no actual shadow). I don't understand why they made these changes, because the characters were fine the way they were (and we all liked them better before). I would like to rate this 4.5 stars instead of 4, if that were an option.

Update: Apparently, the changes had to do with streamlining the process (see discussion), so I am changing my rating to 5 stars.

We have been watching Shaun the Sheep Season 1 on Netflix and my kid loves it. I bought him this DVD because it had all new episodes that he had not seen before. Cute show, similar to Pingu (claymation, no talking, and humorous even for adults).

We love Shaun the Sheep and this collection of episodes isn't disappointing in the least!  The seven episodes on this DVD are:

-  "Spring Lamb" - It's bath time for a reluctant Timmy. In trying to escape, Timmy gets a spring attached to his tail. It's up to the flock to catch the bouncing baby sheep and return him to the tub before he destroys the farm.

-  "Supersize Timmy" - Timmy accidentally eats a tomato grown with "Miracle-Grow" fertilizer and expands to become the King Kong of sheep. Shaun must keep the giant toddler out of sight while trying to figure out how to return him to normal size.

- "Bagpipe Buddy" - The sheep discover a set of bagpipes on the rubbish dump which they immediately misidentify as a sick emu. They set about trying to nurse it back to health before releasing it back into the wild.

- "Cheetah Cheater" - A wildlife film inspires Pidsley the cat to play a prank on the flock by disguising himself as a leopard. Shaun is convinced there is a huge beast on the loose and concocts a plan to catch it.

- "Lock Out" - While preparing for bed, the Farmer manages to lock himself out of the house and is stuck outside in his pajamas. He decides to spend the night in the barn but his incessant snoring drives the flock mad. Shaun heads up an operation to return him to his bed without waking him up.

- "Draw the Line" - The flock hijack a road line-painting machine and cause chaos while creating giant works of art in the field.

- "Ewe've Been Framed" - When Shaun accidentally breaks the farmer's glasses, he and Bitzer have their work cut out trying to prevent their short-sighted master from having mishaps around the farm. Things get a little hair-raising for the flock before Shaun manages to replace the smashed up spectacles.

Bonus features include a game and a bonus Timmy Time episode (a new show centered around Timmy, the baby sheep).  Definitely recommended!

If you already like Shaun the Sheep, or just started watching b/c of Timmy Time, you'll love this DVD. My son (now 3) started watching Shaun a little over a year ago. We were thrilled to see Timmy Time coming on television. This DVD has a lot of Timmy, so naturally, my son loves it. I'm a huge fan of Shaun and Timmy myself. Let's face it, other than teaching kids to bleat, there's not a lot of annoying catch phrases they can pick up on!

I had been a Shaun the sheep fan for two years now, and I love this set by far. espetialy when two of the episodes involve the cutest lamb on earth... Timmy!

My favorite episodes where Spring Lambs, locked out, and the other one whtch involves timmy and a tommato that reminds me of Alice in Wonderland.

What I like about Shaun the Sheep is that they don't really talk but rather just act goofy and funny.  They are mischievous and sneaky, but they always make the whole family laugh!  This DVD is great to get out of the winter funk and start thinking about spring and going outside!
Kids love this and so do I!
Cute gift.  Grandson loved it, priced right and delivered on time....
My 3 years old son loves it.
Great fun on the farm.
Funny.  My grandchildren loved it
My great grandson watches this video while riding in the car, as he is an uneasy rider.  Makes him laugh out loud.
Adorable Shaun is always a hit for me.  I don't know anyone who's seen any Shaun DVDS who isn't impressed with the little guy - and his clever creators.
My niece loves this movie!
Shaun is always a winner!
Really perfect fun for young and old!
Love it !!!
Very nice experience.  DVD was delivered, in good shape, and timely.
Great video....my three year old loves it and watches it in the van whenever we are driving!
My 4yr old loves this dvd.
Shaun the Sheep is good clean fun for generations to enjoy together.  Can't get enough of the laughs.
Great
My Grandson really liked it, we are ordering another dvd with the same sheep.
Liked it ,Grandchildren love it

Purchased these for my grand daughter's and they just adore Shaun!!  I first learned about him and his friends when I was in Paris, France at my daughter's and my 6 year old grand daughter got me hooked!!!!  Can't wait for the Movie!!!
Love Love Love Shaun the sheep!!!!!!
What can I say? This "older senior" sheepherder loves the series. Can't wait for the movie. I hope it plays in my area.
Happy with purchase
Nice entertainment

OH.My. Gosh - these are an absolute hoot. You hear about "good for all ages" - well these REALLY are - from toddlers (nonverbal) to the oldest of the old - really a hoot. Claymation, from the Aran sweater designs to the sheep who drop poop when scared - just a riot. Better for kids than the punch-em-shoot-em-up or dainty-girly pablum offered for kids these days. Just an absolute delight.
Kids love these endearing, funny sheep and farm animals.  They both entertain and instruct in basic decency
This is my son's favorite show. So glad it's available on DVD

Great humor for both children and adults.  No one talks in Shaun the Sheep, even the farmer.  They do use non-verbal noises. It is quite clear to understand what is going on, even without words.  Shaun is not a cartoon, the characters are made out of clay.  This is not an 'in your face' typical kids show.  The sheep do get into lots of crazy non-realistic shenanigans.  This has clever and sometimes subtle humor, mixed with a bit of potty humor (toots).  Episodes last about 6-7 minutes each.  This DVD includes 7 episodes.  You really have to see it to understand.
Excellent product, fast shipping.
we love Shaun the Sheep!!
Great
Always great fun for all the family.  Kids can't get enough of these.
This is another volume that we bought for our grand-daughter, but loved so much we kept it at our house. It is fun to watch with a child or someone who is a child at heart.
This one of our favorite shows at the house. Its that one you put on to fall asleep too, but wake up and keep watching it..without the kids.
Thank You!
This is one of the best Shaun the Sheep DVDs, the one that keeps our 4 and 6-year-old sons entertained longer and the one they pick to watch most often.
My boys love these movies and you can't beat the price!
My grandson enjoyed this at ages 8, 9 and 10 & I enjoyed it right along with him.  Wish they would put out more of these episodes quicker!
Shaun the Sheep are really fun DVDs. They are interesting stories and a lot of fun. I really like the way they are made and produced.
I am a 66 year old grandma and my grandchildren and I love Shaun the Sheep.  I love the animation, and the stories are entertaining for adults -- not just children.
I won about 7 Shaun the Sheep DVD's.  They are all funny for people of all ages.  There are no real spoken words, so it's good for anyone anywhere....

We bought a couple of Shaun the Sheep DVDs to help with a long plane flight.  Our son loved them, and the humor, story and quality of animation keeps it interesting for adults too.  Our son continues to watch and enjoy this.

Each niece received her own video, each different from the others. They all love them, even all their parents. Lots of laughable antics.
Woolcote
I thought that this DVD would have new shows that were not available on Netflix on demand and I was wrong! We had already seen all of them but it is nice to just pop in a DVD versus streaming.
What can you say....all of these Shaun the Sheep videos are hysterical! Looking forward to the movie coming out soon!
Can't get my grandaughter away from watching Chicken Run to watch Shaun Sheep.  I know eventually she will watch this DVD

This is our second Shaun the Sheep DVD (our first is Off the Baa!) and I think Spring Shena-a-anigans may even be funnier! My whole family loves the Shaun the Sheep series (even Grandpa!). Again, such a funny and delightful television show for children that is very age-appropriate. A must have!! I highly recommend this!
Always fun to watch. Nothing else to say and I will not write a review again because there is no need to require a certain number of words
Shaun and the other sheep set out to outwit the sheep dog and every one outwits the farmer.  There is no language  but none is needed and the episodes are short and great fun for all ages.
Shaun is funny for 3 year olds and 68 year olds alike!  I think my grandson and I both have a "british" sense of humor.
fun
My little one loves this movie.  Laughter fills the house when he watches it.
Grandkids favorite show!
GREAT movie. Kids love it!
Way too much repeated material. Too pricey. Come on Rick, the stories are going downhill.

Love Shaun the Sheep
